parts.text:
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (13240044) at the end.  This strongly suggests an intention to engage in electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are typically associated with campaign materials.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions "Dragos-Gabriel Zisopol" and "Uniunea Elena din Romania".  The image clearly shows Zisopol, who is a candidate for the parliamentary elections. This directly fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The use of hashtags (#UniuneaElenaDinRomania #DragosGabrielZisopol #Vot2024) further amplifies its public reach. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's primary objective is to aid voters in identifying Zisopol's position on the ballot paper.  While presented as a helpful guide, this directly influences voters to find and vote for Zisopol. This clearly fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c" as the objective is electoral.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks objective reporting, analysis, or diverse perspectives. Instead, it focuses solely on assisting voters in finding and voting for a specific candidate.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a structured guide designed to facilitate voting for a particular candidate.  The information provided is not subjective or open to interpretation.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>383031788155206</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, a paid Facebook advertisement, features Dragos-Gabriel Zisopol, a candidate for the parliamentary elections, and explicitly aims to help voters locate his name on the ballot. The inclusion of a CMF number further reinforces its nature as electoral propaganda.  While presented as a helpful guide, its sole purpose is to increase votes for Zisopol.  The post's wide reach through Facebook advertising and the use of relevant hashtags solidify its intention to influence the election.  There are no counterarguments to suggest this is not electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>DRAGOŞ-GABRIEL ZISOPOL</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Uniunea Elena din Romania</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Uniunea Elenă din România, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024 (ID postare: 383031788155206), care promovează candidatul Dragoș-Gabriel Zisopol, oferind un ghid pentru a-l identifica mai ușor pe buletinul de vot, având ca efect electoral creșterea numărului de voturi pentru acesta.  Prezența numărului CMF: 13240044 confirmă caracterul de propagandă electorală.  Textul reclamei, imaginea și hashtag-urile utilizate (#UniuneaElenaDinRomania #DragosGabrielZisopol #Vot2024) demonstrează clar intenția de a influența votul în favoarea candidatului menționat.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
